title: Beyonce debuts baby bump at the Grammys 2017 as she takes to stage and performs Mother’s Pride
text:
Beyonce has revealed her baby bump in public for the first time Getty Images 15 The singer performed a song called Mother’s Pride at the Grammys 
In a highly anticipated performance, Beyonce took to the stage to sing Mother’s Pride, revealing her burgeoning bump in public for the first time. 
Wearing a gold sparkling gown which features sheer detailing, the stars figure was on full display. 
Wearing an elaborate gold head dress, the star put on an ethereal performance with a number of dancers in flowing gowns dancing around her surrounded by flowers. AP:Associated Press The performance featured video footage of the singer with her bare bump on show CBS The star put on an ethereal performance Getty Images 15 The singer looked stunning in a sheer and gold glittering gown 
The performance also featured video footage of Beyonce with her bare bump on display being draped in fabric as more women appeared around her. 
At the end of the song, the star grinned and blew lots of kisses to her husband and five-year-old daughter Blue Ivy, who was sat in the audience cheering her on. Getty Images The star looked delighted with her performance Getty Images The proud mother-to-be blew kisses to her daughter Blue Ivy who was in the audience with her dad Jay-Z Getty Images 15 The five-year-old looked cute in a pink suit much like Princes Purple Rain outfit 
The little girl looked super cute in a miniature version of Prince’s Purple Rain suit, complete with ruffled shirt. 
Beyonce lead the nominations with nine nods, but missed out on the Best Pop Solo Performance award, which went to Adele. AP:Associated Press The pregnant star performed on a chair at times throughout the song Getty Images The star looked gorgeous in her ethereal get up 
She was also beaten by The Beatles in the Best Music Film category. 
However during the live broadcast, she won the award for Best Urban Contemporary Album for Lemonade. related stories SUPPORTING MUM Beyonce's adorable daughter Blue Ivy sits on Jay Z's lap at the Grammys as they watch performance LOTS TO CELEBRATE! Jay Z can't hide his joy at pre-Grammys bash two weeks after Beyoncé announces pregnancy SCOTT WHO? Kourtney Kardashian steals the limelight in bra-like top and thigh-split skirt at pre-Grammys party HITTING SOME BUM NOTES Jennifer Lopez, Katy Perry and Lady Gaga fail to impress at Grammy Awards 2017 GETTING IT OFF HER CHEST Lady Gaga shows off plenty of underboob at Grammys 2017 in extremely revealing cut out crop top 
She switched her big headdress for a veil which matched her dress as she took to the stage to collect it. 
Pulling a card out to read, Beyonce seemed a little breathless as she spoke about her inspiration for the album, saying the album existed to confront difficult issues. Getty Images The star won the Best Urban Contemporary Album Getty Images 15 The star read from a card as she explained the inspiration for her album Lemonade 
She said: “Thank you to my beautiful daughter, my fans for bringing me so much happiness and support.“We all experience pain and loss and my intention was to give those people a voice. AP:Associated Press 15 The star wore a veil instead of her big head dress 
“I thank God for my family… it’s important to show images to my children that show their inner beauty. 
“I think it’s vital that we learn from the past.” 
Announcing her pregnancy on Instagram on February 1, Beyonce posed in a berry coloured bra and a pair of pale blue frilly knickers while kneeling on an elaborate display of roses with a sheer veil over her head. Getty Images Beyonce wore an elaborate gold head dress with her gown AP:Associated Press The star performed with a series of dancers 
As she looked directly into the camera, the singer cradled her already visible bump. 
She captioned it: “We would like to share our love and happiness. 
“We have been blessed two times over. We are incredibly grateful that our family will be growing by two, and we thank you for your well wishes. – The Carters.”
